summary: This document is an email chain from December 15, 2021, between law enforcement officers. It details a detective's attempts to contact a potential witness (referred to as 'MI') regarding the Jeffrey Epstein case. The witness's wife (or a female associate) states that 'MI' does not wish to speak and is not scheduled to testify for the defense.

persons.name: Detective NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force
persons.context: The sender/recipient of the email chain, detailing investigative efforts to contact a potential witness in the Epstein case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced by the female contact as the subject of the case the detective is investigating. She asks if the contact attempt is about him.

connections.person1: Detective NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force
connections.description: The detective is investigating the Epstein case and is attempting to contact individuals related to it.

events.title: Initial Contact Attempt with Witness
events.description: A detective called a phone number associated with a potential witness ('MI') and spoke with an unnamed female who agreed to pass along a message.
personsInvolved: Detective NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force

events.title: Follow-up Contact and Witness Refusal
events.description: The detective called again and spoke with the same female, who stated 'MI' did not want to talk, was not a witness, and was not scheduled to testify for the defense in the Epstein case.
personsInvolved: Detective NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force

keyFacts: Law enforcement was actively attempting to contact a potential witness ('MI') in the Epstein case as of December 2021.
The witness, via a female contact (likely a wife or associate), explicitly refused to cooperate, stating he was 'not a witness to anything and has nothing to say.'
The female contact directly linked the investigation to Jeffrey Epstein, asking if the call was about him.
The female contact stated the witness was not scheduled to testify for the defense in the case.
The document shows ongoing post-conviction investigative efforts by a joint NYPD/FBI task force.
